posts.content:
Hi all,

I feel like a slight impostor as I don't have a split screen, I have a 73 bay, but it was originally a Canterbury Pitt conversion.
Recently purchased but unfortunately in transit the pop roof was blown off and damaged. Need to get a quote for fixing it if possible. I would prefer to replace but Im not sure I will find another roof like it as I believe its a Canterbury Pitt.

Does anyone know where I could get another roof? or where I could get it fixed, and finished with original canvas?

Please let me know If you can help so that I can get this sorted.

Thanks

Matt

CP

Some more photos

https://plus.google.com/photos/10683685 ... 7074136449
You should be able to get the fibreglass repaired, it would be a shame to scrap the roof as it rare. Any boat builder should be able to do this for you

If its not too far & he still has it you could try this
viewtopic.php?f=4&t=102024

author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
MJB,
no imposter dude, all are welcome
Do you have any pictures of the interior? I've only ever seen a few pictures of the bay Pitt in a book and they're a proper rare beast. Are you going to VW Action at all? Or bugjam as I'd love to have a look at it in the flesh if you don't mind. Do you have any history at all.
Oh and good luck with the roof dude, as said anyone who works with fibreglass should be able to fix it for you and a sail maker can do you a set of bellows.

Shalom, Lee.
